clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study of a Systematic Approach for Deprescribing of Statins and PPI's.
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of a Systematic Approach for Deprescribing of Statins and Proton Pump Inhibitors in Nursing Home Residents

brief_summary.textblock: Deprescribing, the process of safely reducing or discontinuing unnecessary or harmful medication, has the potential to decrease polypharmacy and improve health outcomes. In this study a structured implicit algorithm, focusing on both extrinsic medication factors (eg change in disease) and intrinsic patient factors (eg. pill burden) will be used.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A multicentre, unblinded, single group (pre-comparison and post-comparison) feasibility study.

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in pill burden (the number of statins and PPI's)
primary_outcome.description: On T0 (intervention) and on T1 + T2 (3 and 6 months after intervention), we will measure the number of PPI's and statins on the medication list of every participant. These are provided by the pharmacist.

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in pill burden (the dose of statins and PPI's)
primary_outcome.description: On T0 (intervention) and on T1 + T2 (3 and 6 months after intervention), we will measure the dose of PPI's and statins on the medication list of every participant. These are provided by the pharmacist.

secondary_outcome.measure: All possible negative side effects of deprescribing (e.g. nausea, symptom recurrence)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention to six months after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: All possible negative effects of deprescribing as recognised by the doctor involved, e.g. symptom recurrence.

Three and six months after intervention we will ask the participating doctors the next questions (per included participant): What did the algorithm advice you? Did you follow the advice? Why dit you follow/deny the advice?

arm_group.description: The aim of this study is to test the feasibility of this algorithm as an intervention to carry out deprescribing a targeted medication group, proton pump inhibitors (PPI's) and statins, among nursing home residents.

intervention.description: For this study an implicit, evidence-supported and patient-centred algorithm has been developed. The outcome of the algorithm is an advice to the doctor to deprescribe or not deprescribe the statin and/or PPI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant uses a statin and/or a proton pump inhibitor.
- Participant signs informed consent.
- Participant is a nursing home resident.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is there for short term nursing home admission (<3 months)
- Participant is there for hospice admission.
